sub_topic: Finding the maximum flow in a network.
message_1:
Consider the following network where the capacities of the edges are as shown:

```
           3            
      A ------- B      
     /  |      /  \     
    /   |6    /    \    
   /    |    /      \   
  /     |  /         \  
 S      | /           T
  \     |/             \
   \    |2            / 
    \   |            /  
     \  |           /   
      C ------- D      
           4            
```

What is the maximum flow that can be sent from the source vertex, `S`, to the sink vertex, `T`, in this network?
message_2:
To find the maximum flow in this network, we can use the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm. We will find augmenting paths and update the residual capacities until no more augmenting paths can be found.

1. First, we find an augmenting path: S -> A -> B -> T. The bottleneck capacity is 3. We update the residual capacities:

```
           0            
      A ------- B      
     /  |      /  \     
    /   |6    /    \    
   /    |    /      \   
  /     |  /         \  
 S      | /           T
  \     |/             \
   \    |2            / 
    \   |            /  
     \  |           /   
      C ------- D      
           4            
```

2. Next, we find another augmenting path: S -> A -> C -> D -> T. The bottleneck capacity is 2. We update the residual capacities:

```
           0            
      A ------- B      
     /  |      /  \     
    /   |4    /    \    
   /    |    /      \   
  /     |  /         \  
 S      | /           T
  \     |/             \
   \    |0            / 
    \   |            /  
     \  |           /   
      C ------- D      
           2            
```

3. Now, we find another augmenting path: S -> C -> D -> T. The bottleneck capacity is 2. We update the residual capacities:

```
           0            
      A ------- B      
     /  |      /  \     
    /   |4    /    \    
   /    |    /      \   
  /     |  /         \  
 S      | /           T
  \     |/             \
   \    |0            / 
    \   |            /  
     \  |           /   
      C ------- D      
           0            
```

At this point, there are no more augmenting paths from S to T. The maximum flow is the sum of the flows on the paths we found: 3 + 2 + 2 = 7. So, the maximum flow that can be sent from the source vertex S to the sink vertex T in this network is 7.
